abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Education Sector Adjustment
            Credit is designed to support the ongoing education sector
            reform program, initiated by the Government of Ghana in
            1986.  Thus far the program has made significant progress in
            addressing three main objectives : a) improving pedagogic
            effectiveness; b) making education financing more efficient
            and equitable; and c) ensuring that the reformed system can
            be sustained using national resources.  The project will :
            1) extend the reform to the senior secondary level,
            introducing more practical content into the curriculum; 2)
            consolidate the reforms initiated at the basic education
            level so that primary and junior secondary school leavers
            acquire the cognitive skills needed to take advantage of the
            education offered at higher levels; and 3) ensuring the
            financial sustainability of the new system now being put
            into place.
